meanings.definition: A person who intimidates or causes fear in others.
meanings.sent1: The schoolyard intimidator made the other kids feel scared.
meanings.sent2: The intimidating presence of the bully made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The little dog thought he was an intimidator, but he was just a fluffy ball of fur.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered like an intimidator looming over the town.
meanings.sent5: The movie villain was portrayed as a ruthless intimidator, striking fear into the hearts of the audience.

meanings.definition: Something that causes fear or intimidation.
meanings.sent1: The dark alley was an intimidator to anyone walking alone at night.
meanings.sent2: The loud thunder was an intimidator for the young child, making him hide under the covers.
meanings.sent3: The spider may be tiny, but it acts like an intimidator to the other insects in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The towering roller coaster was an intimidator in the amusement park, daring people to ride it.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was designed to be an ultimate intimidator, scaring visitors at every turn.
